Blog.post: It's the 26th of June. Is it so much to ask that it be warm and sunny enough that I'm not nervous about leaving the house without a jacket and an umbrella?

I give a lot of credit to the people who decide which order to put songs on a cd in. I'm making a disc for a friend, and I'm having a restupidously tough time deciding what order it should all go in. It's an art, really, especially if you're trying for a particular mood or message. And I'm not even. I just want it to sound right. Also, I'm rather enjoying urlLink Radio Paradise lately. You might too, if you're looking for something kind of mellow and pretty to listen to while you clean the house or drink tea or write poems.

What is the geekiest part of your music collection? Patsy Cline, and a bunch of classical stuff. What do you eat when you raid the fridge late at night? I don't. What is your secret guaranteed weeping movie? Snow White Do you have a completely irrational fear? Yes. What is the little physical habit that gives away your insecure moment? If I'm wearing rings, I'll play with them. Or I bite my lip. Or play with my hair. Are you a pyromaniac? Yeah, sort of. I like fire. Do you know anyone famous? Nope. Who should play you in a movie about your life? Kathy Bates :P Do you know how to play poker? Nope What do you carry with you at all times? Nothing. What do you miss most about being little? Not paying bills. Are you happy with your given name? Yeah. I used to not be. Almost everyone calls me Missy though How much money would it take to get you to give up the internet for one year? None. I'd be okay without it. What color is your bedroom? Yellow, white and clear. What was the last song you were listening to? Snake by Throwing Muses Have you ever been in a play? In highschool. Have you ever been in love? Yeah. Do you talk a lot? Yes. Far too much. Do you like yourself and believe in yourself? Yeah, most of the time. Takes work though. Do you consider yourself to be a nice person? Yeah. There's certain situations where it's impossible, but for the most part I'm alright What's one thing you wish you could do but can't? See my family whenever I want. Favorite fabric? Cotton. Like, t-shirts. Something you love and hate? the internet Do you tell your friends about your sex life? No. What's the one language you want to learn? Italian. How do you eat an apple? I cut it into quarters, then cut out the middle bits. What do you order at a bar? Cosmopolitain, or red wine. Have you ever pierced your body parts? just my ears Do you have tattoos? Not yet. Maybe this summer. What kind of watch(es) do you wear? None. Most frivolous purchase? Hmm. Armani purfume, lots of clothes. Do you consider yourself materialistic? I have a lot of stuff, but none of it matters. What do you cook the best? Mashed potatoes Favorite writing instrument? Black ball point pens, sharpies (any colour but red) and pencils. Do you prefer to stand out or blend in? Stand out, but not irritatingly so. Do you have anything monogrammed? I have a hat with an M on it. Would you ever go out dressed like the opposite sex? Yeah. What kind of books do you like to read? Almost anything. Cookbooks, trashy romance novels, scary stuff... If you won the lottery, what would you do? Pay off my debts, buy a piece of nowhere, put a house and a garden on it, and give anything left to my parents. Burial or cremation? Well, neither right now. How many online journals do you read regularly? A bunch. 30 anyways. What's one thing you're a sore loser at? Nothing. I usually take it pretty well. If you don't like a person, how do you show it? I try not to. Do you cry in front of friends? Not if I can help it. What's one thing you like to do alone? Go for late night walks. Are you a giver or a taker? Oh, I'm such a giver. Most of the time. What have you stolen before? Sometimes I accidentally keep pens (but, not from the store or anything) When's the last time you cried? Sunday Favorite communication method? Conversation, followed by letters. How many drinks before you're tipsy? Sometimes one, depending on what it is. Like, if it's a huge glass of wine. Otherwise, 4-5. I'm a pretty cheap drunk. Do you think you're cute? Nope. Do you think I'm cute? Do you have problems changing clothes in front of friends? I have problems changing clothes in front of my boyfriend for crying out loud.

Yes, I realize a month ago I gave up having a personal blog because I don't have anything to say. Whatever. I realized that even though I didn't have a whole lot to blog about, I missed it when it was gone. (and, J-Rod showed me this pretty pink template, and I just had to have it. Me and my pair of pretty pink blogs, to match my shoes) So, last night we threw a party, kind of a staff get together for all the people J works with. Pretty good time, I must say. If you haven't seen our apartment, you need to know that it is the perfect place for a gathering (except, we don't really have a table. I think it'd be better if we did, but whatever). We could probably get 75 people in here standing up. Not that we're gonna try, but I'm just saying. I love love love having parties, and last night was a goodly one. If we had a table, I'd have everyone over for a sophisticated dinner party (don't worry kids, I'd still let you wrestle and dance around) but 'til then it's just gonna be the standing around type.

Happy July 1st everyone! Like many of my fellow Canadians, deep down I'm fiercly patriotic. I don't litter. I say 'please', 'thank you', and 'eh' an awful lot . I've eaten moose! I know what a chesterfield is (and I've even spilled poutine on one. Pass the serviettes!). I believe in hockey. I think the Queen is pretty alright. We have the prettier half of Niagara Falls. I've kissed boys from 7 different provinces! I can hum the 'hinterland who's who' music, the 'hockey night in Canada' theme song, the theme from 'the friendly giant', and several Tragically Hip tunes. And I get a little weepy when I hear 'O Canada' played. I love it here. It's the kick-assest country on the planet, and I can't imagine living anywhere else.
